intro: Faramea bracteata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false arrowroot, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Faramea bracteata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
